Posted By: Totema (8/29/2012 3:48:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Zo-Zu is definitely better than Ignus..
  
   
Best with an Aggro/RDW deck!
  
   
Whenever I ran out of gas in late game and I have Zo-Zu + Manabarbs + Furnace of Wrath + Vulshok Sorcerer(pinger).. I feel like an aggro turned to control.. my opponents can't do anything..
  
   
They can't tap lands (yes, me too but I still have much higher life vs opponents), they can't fetch/play lands, they're in a lock-down!
  
   
I cast Bolt, 1dmg x2 = 2dmg to me, 6dmg to opponent, oh you're casting negate?.. that's still 2dmg x2 = 4dmg to you.. then my pinger will finish them off.. :D
  
   
I call it a DREAM whenever I have Chandra, the Firebrand + Manabarbs + Furnace of Wrath in the field!
posts.html:
Zo-Zu is definitely better than Ignus..

Best with an Aggro/RDW deck!

Whenever I ran out of gas in late game and I have Zo-Zu + Manabarbs + Furnace of Wrath + Vulshok Sorcerer(pinger).. I feel like an aggro turned to control.. my opponents can't do anything..

They can't tap lands (yes, me too but I still have much higher life vs opponents), they can't fetch/play lands, they're in a lock-down!

I cast Bolt, 1dmg x2 = 2dmg to me, 6dmg to opponent, oh you're casting negate?.. that's still 2dmg x2 = 4dmg to you.. then my pinger will finish them off.. :D

I call it a DREAM whenever I have Chandra, the Firebrand + Manabarbs + Furnace of Wrath in the field!

Posted By: wicked_pick (8/26/2012 8:32:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Why are people talking about casual anti landfall decks? Who plays anti landfall as an archetype? Is landfall totally dominating your local meta? This card hits them for every land they play, its good against control decks which want to drop a land every turn. A red deck should get an opponent down pretty low by turn 4 or 5 and this makes it harder for control players to stabilize since each land brings them closer to Lightning Bolt range. Granted its not all that great but he was not designed to be anti land fall, so he shouldnt even be compared to Tunnel Ignus.
posts.html:
Why are people talking about casual anti landfall decks? Who plays anti landfall as an archetype? Is landfall totally dominating your local meta? This card hits them for every land they play, its good against control decks which want to drop a land every turn. A red deck should get an opponent down pretty low by turn 4 or 5 and this makes it harder for control players to stabilize since each land brings them closer to Lightning Bolt range. Granted its not all that great but he was not designed to be anti land fall, so he shouldnt even be compared to Tunnel Ignus.
